intro: Fumaria muralis var. decipiens, commonly known as the wall rue, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Papaveraceae family and is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, greenish-yellow flowers. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds, which are dispersed by wind. It thrives in rocky or dry habitats, often growing on walls or in cracks in the ground. Its botanical features make it well adapted to arid environments and limited soil conditions.
